# Test cases for test_div: i32.div_s (signed division)
# Format: a b expected (result = a / b, truncated toward zero)
# Note: No division by zero cases (would cause trap)

# 1. Division by 1 and -1 (5 cases)
10 1 10
-10 1 -10
10 -1 -10
-10 -1 10
0 1 0

# 2. Basic Division (5 cases)
10 5 2
20 4 5
100 10 10
1000 100 10
15 3 5

# 3. Positive / Positive (5 cases)
8 2 4
50 5 10
99 9 11
144 12 12
200 25 8

# 4. Negative / Positive (5 cases)
-10 5 -2
-20 4 -5
-100 10 -10
-50 5 -10
-99 9 -11

# 5. Positive / Negative (5 cases)
10 -5 -2
20 -4 -5
100 -10 -10
50 -5 -10
99 -9 -11

# 6. Negative / Negative (5 cases)
-10 -5 2
-20 -4 5
-100 -10 10
-50 -5 10
-99 -9 11

# 7. Truncation Toward Zero (10 cases)
7 3 2
-7 3 -2
7 -3 -2
-7 -3 2
10 3 3
-10 3 -3
10 -3 -3
-10 -3 3
5 2 2
-5 2 -2

# 8. Boundary Values (5 cases)
2147483647 1 2147483647
-2147483648 1 -2147483648
2147483647 2147483647 1
-2147483648 -2147483648 1
2147483646 2 1073741823

# 9. Random Values (5 cases)
12345 67 184
-54321 123 -441
98765 234 422
-87654 -321 273
11111 37 300
